avdta.network

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.Network
      • avdta.network.Simulator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DTASimulator, MTSimulator, SAVSimulator

    public class Simulator
extends Network
    A Simulator extends Network in adding Vehicles and dynamic network loading. Where the Network works with Nodes and Links, Simulator methods are focused on Vehicles.

        Calculates the assignment interval for the current time, based on the assignment duration.
        Returns:
        time/ast_duration

      • ast

        Calculates the assignment interval for the specified time, based on the assignment duration.

        Returns:
        time/ast_duration

      • findVehicle

        public Vehicle findVehicle(int id)
        Iterates through all vehicles to find one matching the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to search for
        Returns:
        a vehicle with the specified id, if one exists, or null otherwise.

      • getAvgLinkDensity

        public double getAvgLinkDensity()
        Calculates the average link density as the average over all links.
        Returns:
        the average link density (veh/mi)

      • getVehicles

        public java.util.List<Vehicle> getVehicles()

        Returns:

      • getNumVehicles

        public int getNumVehicles()
        Returns the number of vehicles in the network.
        Returns:
        the number of vehicles in the network

      • getNumBuses

        public int getNumBuses()
        Returns the number of transit vehicles. This method iterates through all vehicles and counts which vehicles are transit (see Vehicle.isTransit()).
        Returns:
        the number of buses

      • getNumExited

        public int getNumExited()
        This method iterates through all vehicles and counts which ones have exited (see Vehicle.isExited()).
        Returns:
        the number of exited vehicles

      • resetSim

        public void resetSim()
        Resets the simulator to restart the simulation. This calls Link.reset() for all Links, Node.reset() for all Nodes, and Vehicle.reset() for all Vehicles.

      • getLastExitTime

        public int getLastExitTime()
        Returns the time the last vehicle exited, or the duration if a vehicle did not exit.
        Returns:
        the time the last vehicle exited (s)

      • getTSTT

        public double getTSTT()
        Returns the total system travel time. This method iterates over all vehicles, and sums their travel time (see Vehicle.getTT()).
        Returns:
        the total system travel time(s)

      • getFFTT

        public double getFFTT()
        Returns the total free flow travel time. This method iterates over all vehicles and finds the free flow path (see FFTime).
        Returns:
        the total free flow travel time (s)

      • findPath

        public Path findPath(PersonalVehicle v,
                     TravelCost costFunc)
        Finds a path for the specified vehicle using the specified cost function. This runs Dijkstra's and traces the shortest path for the relevant origin-destination pair. Calls Network.findPath(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost) using the vehicle's parameters.
        Parameters:
        v - the Vehicle
        costFunc - the cost function
        Returns:
        the shortest path
        See Also:
        TravelCost

      • getTotalEnergy

        public double getTotalEnergy()
        Returns the total energy consumed. This method iterates over all vehicles and sums their energy consumption (see Vehicle.getTotalEnergy()).
        Returns:
        the total energy consumption

      • getTotalVMT

        public double getTotalVMT()
        Returns the total vehicle miles traveled. This method iterates over all vehicles and sums their travel distance (see Vehicle.getPath() and Path.getLength()).
        Returns:
        the total vehicle miles traveled

      • getAvgDepTime

        public int getAvgDepTime(int ast)
        This returns the midpoint of the departure time for the specified assignment interval index. The assignment interval index counts from 0 upwards.
        Parameters:
        ast - the assignment interval index
        Returns:
        (ast)+0.5) * ast_duration

      • getAvgMPG

        public double getAvgMPG()
        Returns the average miles per gallon over all vehicles. This method iterates over all vehicles and averages their miles per gallon (see Vehicle.getMPG()).
        Returns:
        the average miles per gallon

      • getNodeDemand

        public int getNodeDemand(Node n)
        Returns the number of vehicles using the specified Node. This method sums over all vehicles and checks whether their path contains the specified Node (see Vehicle.getPath() and Path.containsNode(avdta.network.node.Node)).
        Parameters:
        n - the Node being checked
        Returns:
        the number of vehicles using the specified Node

      • printIntersectionDemands

        public void printIntersectionDemands()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This prints the Node demands for all Nodes to the file Project.getResultsFolder()/intersection_demand.txt. This calls getNodeDemand(avdta.network.node.Node) for all Nodes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be accessed

      • printLinkVC

        public void printLinkVC()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAvgTT

        public double getAvgTT(DriverType driver)
        Returns the average travel time for the given driver type. Note that all vehicles of the same type (i.e. all autonomous vehicles) should share the same DriverType instance.
        Parameters:
        driver - the driver
        Returns:
        the average travel time for the given driver type (s)

      • getAvgTT

        public double getAvgTT(int type)
        Returns the average travel time for vehicles matching the specified type code
        Parameters:
        type - the type code
        Returns:
        the average travel time for vehicles matching the specified type code

      • getAvgBusTT

        public double getAvgBusTT(boolean transit)
        Returns average travel times for transit or non-transit vehicles
        Parameters:
        transit - checks transit vehicles if true, checks non-transit vehicles if false
        Returns:
        average travel times for transit or non-transit vehicles (s)

      • getBusTT

        public double getBusTT(boolean transit)
        Returns total travel times for transit or non-transit vehicles
        Parameters:
        transit - checks transit vehicles if true, checks non-transit vehicles if false
        Returns:
        total travel times for transit or non-transit vehicles (s)

      • printNodeVC

        public void printNodeVC()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Prints Node volume/capacity ratios to the file Project.getResultsFolder()/node_vc.txt. This iterates over all vehicles and nodes, checking whether the Vehicle uses the Node.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is not found

      • setVehicles

        public void setVehicles(java.util.List<Vehicle> vehicles)
        Sets the vehicles to the specified list, and sorts them by departure time.
        Parameters:
        vehicles - the new list of vehicles.

      • simulate

        public void simulate()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Simulates (dynamic network loading) the network. The simulation runs until the duration is reached or all vehicles have exited. This simultaneously writes the VAT (vehicle arrival time) file (see getVatFile()). For each time step, this calls addVehicles() and propagateFlow().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • postProcess

        public void postProcess()
        Post-process simulation data to prepare for printing results, such as average link flows. This contains an internal check to avoid post-processing multiple times.

      • createSimVat

        public void createSimVat(java.io.File outputFile)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This file creates the sim.vat file, which is a VISTA output, from the vehicle arrival times file.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - the output file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed.

      • getVatFile

        public java.io.File getVatFile()
        Returns the vehicle arrival times file.
        Returns:
        Project.getResultsFolder()/vat.dat

      • simulationFinished

        public void simulationFinished()
        This method is called when the simulation has finished.

      • printLinkTdd

        public void printLinkTdd()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method prints the flowin.csv and linktt.csv files, which are VISTA outputs used for visualization. This also calls postProcess().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • isSimulationFinished

        protected boolean isSimulationFinished()
        Returns whether all vehicles have exited.
        Returns:
        whether all vehicles have exited

      • addVehicles

        public void addVehicles()
        This iterates through all vehicles. If the simulation time (time) has passed the vehicle's departure time, the vehicle is added to its starting link.

      • propagateFlow

        protected void propagateFlow()
        This executes one time step of simulation. This calls Link.prepare(), Link.step(), Node.step(), then Link.update() for all Links and Nodes.

      • printLinkFlow

        public void printLinkFlow(int start,
                          int end)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This calls printLinkFlow(int, int, File) with the file Project.getResultsFolder()/linkq.txt.
        Parameters:
        start - the start time (s)
        end - the end time (s)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • printLinkFlow

        public void printLinkFlow(int start,
                          int end,
                          java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This prints the average link flows for each assignment interval index within the start and end times.
        Parameters:
        start - the start time (s)
        end - the end time (s)
        file - the output file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • getActiveVehicles

        public int getActiveVehicles()
        This calculates the number of active vehicles by iterating over all non-centroid connector Links.
        Returns:
        the number of active vehicles

      • printLinkTT

        public void printLinkTT(int start,
                        int end)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This calls printLinkTT(int, int, java.io.File) with the file Project.getResultsFolder()/linkq.txt.
        Parameters:
        start - the start time (s)
        end - the end time (s)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • printLinkTT

        public void printLinkTT(int start,
                        int end,
                        java.io.File file)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This prints average link travel times for all assignment interval indexes between the start and end times.
        Parameters:
        start - the start time (s)
        end - the end time (s)
        file - the output file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • printLinkTT

        public void printLinkTT(int start,
                        int end,
                        java.io.File file,
                        java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> linkids)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This prints average link travel times for all assignment interval indexes between the start and end times.
        Parameters:
        start - the start time (s)
        end - the end time (s)
        file - the output file
        linkids - the set of links to include
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • printLinkFlow

        public void printLinkFlow(int start,
                          int end,
                          java.io.File file,
                          java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> linkids)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This prints average link flows for all assignment interval indexes between the start and end times. Note that this only works for LTM links.
        Parameters:
        start - the start time (s)
        end - the end time (s)
        file - the output file
        linkids - the set of links to include
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • getWaitingVehicles

        public int getWaitingVehicles()
        This calculates the number of vehicles waiting on centroid connectors.
        Returns:
        the number of vehicles waiting on centroid connectors

      • getBusFFTime

        public double getBusFFTime()
        This calculates the total travel time of buses at free flow. This method iterates all vehicles and sums Vehicle.getPath() and Path.getFFTime() for transit vehicles.
        Returns:
        the total travel time of buses at free flow

      • calcAvgBusTimeRatio

        public double calcAvgBusTimeRatio()
        This calculates the average bus travel time ratio. This iterates over all vehicles and averages the travel time ratio for transit vehicles. The travel time ratio is Vehicle.getTT()/the vehicle free flow travel time.
        Returns:
        the average bus travel time ratio

      • calcAvgBusDelay

        public double calcAvgBusDelay()
        This calculates the average transit delay. The delay is the travel time - the free flow travel time. This iterates over all vehicles and sums the delay for transit vehicles.
        Returns:
        the average transit delay

      • printBusTime

        public void printBusTime(java.io.File file)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This prints bus travel times and free flow travel times to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - the output file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be accessed

      • createVehicleIdsMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Vehicle> createVehicleIdsMap()
        Returns a mapping of ids to vehicles.
        Returns:
        a mapping of ids to vehicles

      • connectivityTest

        public boolean connectivityTest()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
